data.title: Interesting Modern Capitol
data.text: We are on a road trip to all 48 contiguous states.  We include the state capitol in each state.  This is one of the few that has completely abandoned its historic capitol and constructed a relatively new office complex to replace the old structure.  The 22-story office building is worth viewing.  It takes about 45 minutes to complete the self-guided tour using a printed guide available at the information desk.  Be sure to check out the rotunda displays and go up to the 22nd floor observatory.  Don't wait for the one and only elevator leading up to the 22nd floor.  Take another up to the 19th, then switch elevators for the remaining ride up.  Great view!  Parking is available in the parking structure about one block away, northwest of the capitol complex.  Be sure to check out the adjacent historic capitol building which has been restored and is used as a museum.

data.title: Go to the top!
data.text:
If you've never been to the top of the capital, you're missing out! It's completely free and easy. You just walk in, go through security, and up to the top floor of the elevator.
Tallahassee's best kept secret! You can see everything in town! The most amazing view by far

data.title: Nice way to spend a summer afternoon
data.text: The new capitol building is a gorgeous building filled with fine art, paintings, portraits and murals.  You can see the house and senate floors, and on every floor there is artwork to be admired.  Be sure to go to the 22nd floor for a panoramic view of the city.

data.title: Get to see Tallahassee from Above
data.text: The top floor, elevator to travel up, is a wonderful place to look in all four directions.  Descriptions tell what you are seeing.  A great way to see above the trees.

data.title: Interesting Place
data.text: Get to see your state capital at work. Interesting and informative. It is a little hard to find and the streets are pretty narrow.

data.title: educational trip with the boys
data.text: i took my son's on a self guided tour of our great capital buildings both old and new.  the view from the new capital is awesome on a clear day. for a lover of history the old capital is great. the only capital not taken during the Civil War.

data.title: Ugh. Bland. Boring.  Tour the Old Capitol Building instead
data.text: I'm assuming this review is about the New Building which from the distance-- thanks to some architectural design joke of a flaw--looks like a certain part of the male anatomy.  It is stupifingly boring. An unintentional paean to idiocy in design. The old Capitol Building, however, is gorgeous. You walk into that building and you find yourself in the middle of history.  The new Capitol Building -- ah, they might as well be selling insurance.

data.title: A very unlikely building for a capital
data.text: The highlight of this 22 story capital building is the observation deck on the 22 nd floor.This is the tallest building in Tallahassee. You can also visit the Senate and House of Representative Chambers.

data.title: Basic office building, the old ones better
data.text: Had some business here, the new part is just a big old building but there is a great view of the area from top floor.

data.title: Wonderful view on the 22nd floor
data.text: We loved the visit to the top of this building where sites were marked for you to pick them out in the distance.  They had a nice photo exhibit too.  The legislative area was underwhelming and closed off except to see through the glass walls.  Plenty of marble inside this building.  Too bad they don't have a very pretty outside since the plaza area is in disrepair and was showing the results of storm Hermine which no one had cleaned up on any of the stairs.  In general some more money should be spent to spiff up the state capitol building's outside.  The site itself is nice with impressive dolphin statues but the plaza needs work.

data.title: Great Views from the Top
data.text: In an otherwise nondescript tower and office building, the view from the observation center of Tallahassee is incredible

data.title: View from 22nd floor
data.text: Though only certain elevators get you there, take the elevator to the 22nd floor for a view "as far as the eye can see" of Tallahasse and its environs. The building is so tall that it not only dwarfs the next door old Capitol, but you can't see it looking down from the 22nd floor.  The 5th floor provides access to the House of Representatives; the Senate is closed for renovations.  The entry floor has Florida tourist information next to security.  The visitor information area will provide self-guiding map and information on the building.  Go across to the Old Capitol which is very interesting with historic information.

data.title: Florida's state capitol
data.text: It was pretty great to go inside and see where my home state's government works.There really wasn't anything for a visitor to do except see the observation tower on the 22nd (top) floor and see where Florida's government works so I wouldn't recommend visiting the capitol with children.

data.title: 360 degree viewing from the 22nd Floor!
data.text: At the top of the Capitol, there is usually an art exhibition to see, as well as giant, continuous windows all around (with photomaps generally explaining what you are seeing). I don't get tired of going up there!

data.title: Great Architecture!!!!
data.text: I was killing time driving around Tallahassee and decided to see the Capitol building.... it's pretty cool to look at and imagine the engineering and building that went into this place... I love to see different varieties of architecture wherever and whenever I travel!!!  It's worth the drive to see and appreciate its genesis.

data.title: great views
data.text: the views from the twenty second floor observation area were very nice.  We enjoyed the visit and recommend it.

data.title: Odd structure with windows that have prison like bars!
data.text: The interior of this office building does have a rotunda type feature and was more traditional in spots . The House chambers were nice and the Senate side is undergoing renovation. Pretty quiet since the legislature was not in session.  Parking is hard to find for visitors.  Love the views from the top f;oor.

data.title: Go for the view
data.text: It's worth the stop for a free tour of the building, but it doesn't have a ton to offer.  Go to the top for a nice panoramic view of the city.

data.title: Boring
data.text: This is an ugly building, despite having been designed by Edward Durrell Stone. The observation area on the top floor is desolate - an empty space, looking out on nothing much more than other government buildings. Entry is unwelcoming - awkward to find too. The public areas of the building were empty and quiet - admittedly, the legislature was not in session so there was not much going on. The ceilings in the 3 rotundas are low - this is just an unattractive building: boring, institutional - and way too large for its site.

data.title: Yoour State Capitol
data.text: If you are in the area worth a brief visit.  Where Fla government happens.  No tour.  Observation deck is worth the elevator ride.  Café is a nice stop for coffee, etc.
